This is one of the most beautiful games I've played. Both it's style and artwork are phenomenal, and I found myself enjoying the scenery for multiple minutes at a time. 
However, this is the best part of the game in my opinion. The game's story seemed very interesting at the beginning, and i liked how mysterious everything was. Sadly a partial explanation was given very quickly, which in my opinion should be distributed throughout the story a bit better. In contrast, characters are written exceptionally well, especially Booker and Elizabeth, who feel like real people. Sadly, the game tries to tackle more storylines than it can finish, resulting in many abandoned opportunities. The ending wasn't my favourite either. While i didn't hate it, i found myself wondering "wow, is this really it? the big finale to this story?".
Now the gameplay - its ok. I haven't played many shooters (spent 4 years on minecraft and league...), and i didnt find this one to be bad, but rather average. I dislike the fact only 2 guns can be held at a time, and some feel like they were only added to be "a bit extra". I only used 2 guns for most of the playthrough, since the non-upgraded ones feel useless. The vigor system is cool, but not balanced very well. Tears also add an additional element to your strategy. Sadly, fights get repetitive quickly. While I still enjoyed a good amount of fights, many felt like the exact same thing.

Overall, the game is still fun and enjoyable, but has its flaws. While I bought this game with a discount, I still believe it is worth its full price.
7,5 / 10

Cuando jugue al Bioshock 1 y 2 me quede con la boca abierta, y ahora que tenia espacio para descargarme el juego que escuche que estaba genial, lo alcanze a jugar. 

La historia es increibley al principio facil de entender, el problema viene cuando estas casi al final porque yo me tuve que poner a reflexionar sobre que habia pasado. Algo que agradezco es que me tomo mas de 4 dias para poder terminar el juego, lo que significa que es largo y es muy disfrutable, y todo esta muy bien pensado para la jugabilidad, ademas de que yo por lo menos no encontre ningun bug y eso es hermoso. Los graficos son espectaculares, y el doblaje es fascinante, las armas son un deleite porque cada una es diferente, y los "plasmidos" aunque no se llamen asi en este juego, cambiaron mucho (dejando de lado al rayo). Y la manera en la que el juego te permite pegar Headshots es hermoso. 

La unica cosa que me disgusto fue cerca del final, llega una parte en la que la municion se me hizo escasa y tuve que usar el arma melee como ultimo recurso. 

Sinceramente una obra maestra, vale la pena jugarse a todos los bioshocks para esto.
Tremendo juegazo que se aventaron!! Es Bioshock pero mejorado uwu

And here we are, finishing all the games on the franchise. Man, what a journey. It was all worth it; even if I disagree with a few changes.

It is a little unfair to compare the tone of the fist two games against this one, since they had to come up with something different and let's face it, submarine, gentically-altered junkies in a fallen, utopic society are THOUGH to beat; replacing it with racial tensions leaves Infinite feeling a little crude. I changed my mind as I saw the story develop and what the revolution could and would mean if given their way; when I was falling in love with the complexity of the story... the DLC ruined it for me. Now instead of two warring factions struggling to fight for what they thought was right in an interestingly fleshed out story of very human characters, there are now a paragon of all good and a cartoonish villain. Man, what a waste.

That aside, the game is far more linear than its predecessors which makes the 'scavenging around' experience feel a little less meaningful. The atmosphere is less terrifying although the variety of enemies and weapon is much larger; and I'm not sure about the replacement of genetic tonics with simple pieces of equipment you can change on the fly.

That's all the bad. The story is for the most part, masterfully written and displayed, although they definitely strayed away from the 'show, don't tell' the first Bioshock had. Elizabeth is one of the best supporting characters I've seen as far as I've seen. She's not annoying or needs protection, and actually helps out in meaningful and lore-friendly ways, it is a little weird see her leap 15 feet up or from the air like she was human-bird hybrid. 

It's a worthy addition to the franchise although not the best of the trilogy. A good enough job was done in all fronts; very much worth picking up although unless there is a bundle deal going on, check which DLCs to pick and choose; not all of them are worth it.
